unnormalised: Okay, so you're planning a road trip across India? Awesome! It's definitely an adventure. A lot depends on where you're starting and where you want to go. For example, a drive from Delhi to Agra via the Yamuna Expressway is a breeze, maybe 3–4 hours (approx. 240 km). But tackling the Northeast? That's a whole different ballgame. Roads can be unpredictable, especially during the monsoon. Plus, petrol prices vary a bit from state to state – keep that in mind when budgeting.

unnormalised: Road conditions are key. NH44 (the north-south corridor) is generally good, but expect tolls. A FASTag is almost essential these days, saves a ton of time. If you're hiring a car, double-check the paperwork and insurance. Also, learn some basic Hindi phrases – it can really help in smaller towns. Don't rely solely on Google Maps; sometimes local advice is best. My cousin drove from Mumbai to Goa last year (approx. 600 km) and said the coastal route was beautiful, but took closer to 14 hrs because of the traffic near Panvel.

unnormalised: Finally, safety first! Indian roads can be chaotic. Stick to speed limits (often posted in kmph, of course!), and be aware of trucks and buses. Carry water and snacks, especially if you're travelling in remote areas. A power bank for your phone is a must. Remember to check weather forecasts, especially if you’re planning a trip involving mountain passes or coastal regions that are prone to cyclones. And if you're planning to drive, say, 1200 km over 2 days, plan for breaks and sharing the driving with someone if possible. Happy travels!
